Reviews.Title: “Not WOWed by the food”
Reviews.Author: MarkSteffens
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 5-star - very spacious room, super close to the airport, excellent service. However sadly the food at their "fine dining" restaurant for dinner was simply terrible. I ordered an Entecotte steak, medium rare, the small thin piece of meat came out well done with a side of instant mash and cold from the tin mushrooms. They quickly brought out a new steak but it was still far below what I'd expect at a star hotel let alone a 5 star. My partner didn't fare much better with the chicken schnitzel. The "baked" rice desert would normally in Turkey be served hot, but it came straight from the fridge with ice cream. Food aside the service was good and very friendly. The room also included a "regular" shuttle service to and from the airport but at 9:10pm we would have had to wait 35 minutes for the next one, and at 4am for our departure there was no shuttle. A more on-call service would match similar western 5-star hotels, but it was a less than 10 lira cab ride so not really an issue.

Reviews.Title: “COULD NOT SLEEP”
Reviews.Author: Pina77951
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night in September '11 due to transit and it being close to the airport. Firstly the cab driver wasnt happy that he dropped us off so close to the airport. The "sound proof rooms" are not the case. After a 27 hour flight the people next door were at it like animals and we could hear everything. I couldnt stand it no longer and decided to sit at the lobby , even waiting for the lifts i could hear them clearly. Thats not what you need after a long flight. The hotel wasnt that crowded so i have no idea why we were put so close to other people. Breakfast was disgusting. I have had much better breakfast at 3 star places. The food looked tired and not fresh. there were flies on the food which turned me off eating. The staff at the breakfast area were more concerned about gossipping about their night rather then looking after the 2 guests that were at the buffet breakfast. Lucky for me i can understand Turkish. We ordered coffee which took 20 minutes to arrive and when it did it was undrinkable. It was everything but coffee. For the price this hotel charges one would think the service they provide would match that however this wasnt the case with this hotel. I wouldnt stay there again, i would rather wait at the airport all night for my flight in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “not going back”
Reviews.Author: kaizerStyria
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the wow (4star as there is also a 5 star next door) from March 1st to March 3rd 2012. the room was not in good condition and the floor looked bad to say the least. a word of warning, beware of any extras not included in the rate such as cafe late from the bar for breakfast, they will cost you a fortune.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, clean and convenient airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: daisyfae
Reviews.Content: After reading some earlier reviews, i was concerned that the WOW Airport Hotel would be a dump. Far from it. It is a convenient, and reasonably priced full-service airport hotel. There aren't many other options in the area if you're looking for this location, and we found the hotel far exceeded expectations. Complimentary shuttle from Ataturk airport runs on the half hour, or a 7 TL (~$3.50) taxi ride. Efficient front desk staff - this is a very busy hotel, so don't expect to be overwhelmed with smiles and fussiness! The desk staff was handling a barrage of people from many parts of the earth when we arrived, and they did so fairly quickly and without international incident, despite the rudeness of some of the guests. Our room was clean, and high-tech -- the television was mounted on the wall through a mirror, and light/controls are on a console by the bed. A quirk: Motion-sensor activated lighting in the hallway would occasionally lag, so the hallway would be dark for a few extra steps. But eventually they clicked on. Complimentary breakfast included with the price of the room. Good variety of foods offered, including fresh fruit. Fresh coffee. Enough fuel to get to the airport. Free wireless available in the lobby and restaurant. Wired internet is complimentary in the rooms. Staff will provide an ethernet cable if you don't have one. If you are expecting a location where you can go out and wander the streets, finding that perfectly charming little cafe, or perhaps some live music in a jazz club? You will be disappointed. But if you're spending the night close to Ataturk Airport prior to leaving Istanbul, it's good value, efficient and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: K2136
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel close to convention center - clean, nice breakfast, nice rooms - very good for business - not best location for travel - Sultanhamed and Taksim are far away but Airport is very close to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “WOW says it all!”
Reviews.Author: markmctaggart
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night in the 5 star part of the hotel. Got a good last minute deal in an executive room and the room was much better than other 5 star hotels i've stayed in in Istanbul. What was really nice was in the evening their was a decent buffet with alcholic drinks included in the rate. As it's so close to the airport, its an exellent stopover if you have an early flight. Exceeded my expectations!

Reviews.Title: “ideal stop off”
Reviews.Author: cherkal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we were visiting family for a few days, before travelling onto our main resort. I picked this hotel for the distance from the airport, a 5 min ride in a taxi, we stayed in the 5 star hotel, (there is a 4 star connected) i picked the 5 star as there was a pool, however the kids couldnt go in, as you had to be over 16, (it was more like a fitness pool) i do wish it had of told us this before we booked, however, i couldnt fault the hotel, we had 2 lovely rooms, that were clean and very nice, the breakfast buffet was delicious, it was a bit more expensive than what i would normally pay, but worth it, i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for an over night stop”
Reviews.Author: Marby1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel post cruise, before an early flight the next day. There are 2 hotels called WOW. One is 4 star and the other 3 star attached by a convention centre. We stayed at the 3 star one. We had difficulty getting information on local resturants from the front desk, so we walked over to the 4 star hotel for information. The front desk staff was more informative. They did try to sell us a dinner downtown, with a "free" shuttle service to the resturant. But they also explained to us how to take the train downtown. Since we had stayed in the old town pre cruise, we were excited to get back downtown. THe train was quite convienent, a 3 minute walk from the hotel. Having experienced the train/tram pre cruise, we had no trouble. We did have to make a transfer, but it was easy. We enjoyed a dinner downtown, picked up a few souveniers, for less than $50 US including a beer. We were so glad that we ventured out of the hotel. One note, since the water in Turkey is not drinkable, you have to purchase water. This hotel did not sell it anywhere except at the bar. So if you do stay here, buy a water bottle prior to checking in. Otherwise, transfer to the airport was convienent. I rated it Average because I didn't expect much from an airport hotel. The hotel was a convenient location for a quick overnight stop.

Reviews.Title: “Three/four star hotel at five star prices”
Reviews.Author: Ben314
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business, with some colleagues (the expo center is a short walk across the road). I must say that I am very skeptical of the glowing positive reviews for this hotel. The rooms weren't particularly special (in fact, they appeared to be identical to the rooms in the Wow four star hotel attached to the same building), and particularly so when considering the price. The staff had a bad attitude and zero service culture. There was little interest in helping and service was very slow. The wife of one of my colleagues was propositioned by a male member of staff. Food and drinks were very expensive, and the service in the bar was glacial -- the barmen seemed more interested in talking to each other and flirting with women, than in doing their job. Not to mention the fact that I was initially billed for drinks I did not order. The rooms weren't particularly clean -- my colleagues in another room developed a rash after sitting on the floor. The only redeeming feature of the hotel is its proximity to the airport and expo center. My guess is that this guaranteed source of business is why they're able to get away with what they do. If this hotel were only three or four star and the pricing was in line with what they offered, I would have been reasonably okay with it all. However, I felt they over promised, over charged and under delivered. If convenience is what you're after, I would recommend staying a little bit further a way and getting up slightly earlier.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely NOT a five star”
Reviews.Author: nirtak99
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our last night in Turkey becuase we had an early flight out. It is very close and convenient to the airport, but I was disappointed in several aspects. 1) There are two WOW hotels right next to each other. Before they would let us out of the hotel shuttle, they made me find my reservation and prove to them I was staying at the 5 star one. 2) Our baby cots were set up when we got to the room, which was nice, but one of them had a huge hole ripped in the side, which is not safe for a baby. We didn't feel like dealing with it, and figured it would be OK for our 2 year old, but a 5 star hotel? Come on. 3) I boked this one specifically because it had a pool, the bellman made a point to tell us all about the pool when he took us to our room. Our 2 year old was super excited about visiting the pool, so we thought a quick dip before dinner would be nice. We got all ready and went up to the pool, where we were asked if we had swim caps. We said no, and she said they were mandatory, so we asked to borrow some. She said they didn't have any to borrow, but we could buy them for 10 Lira each. For a family of 4, 40 lira for a 15 minute swim at a hotel we already paid for was ridiculous. Our daughter immediately started crying and they didn't seem to care. 4) For an airport hotel they weren't set up for early morning travel. We had to leave for the airport at 5:30am and we were told we had to take a taxi because the shuttle didn't start until 6. We also couldn't get anything for our included breakfast. The only reason this hotel got two starts instead of 1 is because the staff at dinner were so wonderful. They had a buffet that we didn't want because we wanted something light, but when our food came our daughter decided she didn't want it and wanted potatoes. We asked if we could have a couple from the buffet and about 4 staff members jumped to fill up plats with everything they could think of that a two year old might want. It was so funny to see her with plates piled all around her at her own little "Turkish Feast." So cheers to the dining room staff, boos to the rest of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “amazing price for what you get!”
Reviews.Author: Fletscher
Reviews.Content: I am amazed by the extermely large room (standard), offering everything you need for a pleasant and productive time as business traveller. Located next to AtatÃ¼rk airport, it is or extremely handy or a bit off. For me being close to the airport was more important than having close access to shopping or dinning areas. However, by taking a taxi you are not very far from the harbour area either - a very good compromise. The cable for Internet you have to ask for and they charge you extra - in the end I think they did not charge it. The breakfast is very OK. The atmosphere is not very inviting for having a beer on the lobby bar. But the price is unbeatable and I can only recommend this one!

Reviews.Title: “Not Quite A 5-Star Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kmalho
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 5-star WOW Hotel, there is a 4-star WOW Hotel right next door and it is very confusing which booking you actually have; especially as this trip was booked through a corporate travel account. The lobby is very nice and oozes 5-star residence, however that is where it ends. The rooms are very basic and not worth of 5-star status. But only staying in the hotel for one night before a flight wasn't bad. The WOW Hotel was ideally located for the airport however far enough not to hear the highways or planes taking off. In addition, the grounds of the hotel complex are quite nice however there didn't seem to be anything within walking distance. The centre of Istanbul is around 30 minutes taxi ride away, and will cost between 30-50 lira depending on the time of day and the taxi driver's route.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for the exhibition centre”
Reviews.Author: GFM_59
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the week whilst supporting an exhibition at the centre which is 5 minutes walk away. There are two hotels here a 4* airport hotel and a 5* one. Stayed in the 4* one and although having a reservation for a non-smoking room was told that the hotel was full and there was only a smoking room. (basically take it or leave it.) Room was on the 15th floor and the window was shut with the handle removed for child safety reasons, so no fresh air. Lucky for the travel toolkit that was soon solved. Access to the city is from the close-by metro station, so more reasonable priced restaurants are available, because the on-site one was rather expensive although the food was good. Be aware they don't like you bringing in water and soft drinks for the room. The security guard wanted me to talk to reception for a bag of water and coke. If they charged a reasonable price in the minibar I wouldn't bother going to get it. Anyway if you want to flout the rules the Carrefour Express is across the road to the left of the hotel extrance.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mcwcBaku
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight in this hotel to break the journey. It is close to the airport, but the shuttle had finished by the time our (delayed) flight got in, and we got got bamboozled into a 20 euro "limo" ride. If we had felt stronger we would have looked for a taxi. The hotel checked us in easily, and upgraded rooms so we could have connecting rooms. Very nice rooms although not everything worked. Helpful and friendly staff. Good Turkish breakfast buffet (i.e. lots of cheese but no pork and indifferent coffee). It was cheaper (even including the visa fees) than staying in the airport hotel, and we did get the shuttle back to the airport. Unlike the airport hotel, this one has a pool etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rkarunak
Reviews.Content: Needed to spend a night during transit - so, we chose this hotel. We were traveling as a family(2 adults & 2 kids) - we were forced to take 2 rooms. Good thing was that we were given adjacent rooms with a connecting door. Rooms had all the basic necessities. We used the airport shuttle both ways - pretty convenient. Breakfast was good - very nice selection. Took a 5min taxi ride to a big multi-storied mall for dinner - found some good Turkish food in the food court at the mall. Overall, good transit hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Worth paying for a 5 Star hotel at Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: ravisaraf
Reviews.Content: Wow hotel is located near to the Istanbul airport with a good connectivity to the City by Metro. Although, there are 2 wow hotel located next to each other BUT I had stayed at Wow 5*, which I found to be worth of what I paid for. Staff were very nice and the breakfast was too good with huge number of dish selection. You can even exchange money at the hotel reception at a good rate. Internet here is free and has good speed.

Reviews.Title: “It can't be 5*”
Reviews.Author: vesiter
Reviews.Content: Staff are unprofetional & not qualified, some are very rude & have no respect to customers. smoke smell everywhere in the room, me and the children could not tolerate that.

Reviews.Title: “Rock hard beds”
Reviews.Author: simonsmidt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is listed as Hotel&Convention center, but is known as Wow Istanbul. It is the 5* hotel which is next to the Wow Airport hotel. So, you might get confused, as I was, when trying to look for reviews of Wow Istanbul. It is claiming to be a 5* hotel, but I would not give it to them. Why? - I can only agree with the previous reviewer, Bob, about the beds. It is indeed like sleeping on the floor. I stayed here 3 nights and now I have pain in my shoulders because of these lousy rock hard beds. After the first night I asked the reception if I could change to another room for the other 2 nights. They said no, as the whole (5*, remember?) hotel has the same type of beds. If you are a real 5* hotel you will have different types of beds available. So, with that statement they already loose 1*. - You can't open a window in the room, forcing you to use the air conditioning. Also during the night. I don't like to sleep with the airco on, but I was lucky these 3 nights as the outside temperature was not that high. Around 20 degrees. I can imagine how it would be if it is 40 degrees....... - Breakfast looks to have a lot of choices, which is indeed true, you'll have a lot of choice, but for me not the right choice. I've been in quite a lot of Middle-Eastern hotels (see my contributions) and this is indeed a Middle-Eastern breakfast buffet. Nothing wrong with that, but not my taste. I would like to have some butter on my bread, a pancake prepared by the cook would be nice, and some Nutella is something I like as well on my sandwich. Nothing of these were available. - It was probably due to Ramadan, but the bars (roof bar and lobby bar) were empty as well, not contributing to a lively atmosphere in the hotel. - The staff itself is friendly, although those at breakfast were looking on their watch a bit too much. Which shows of little enthusiasm. Concluding I can give this hotel only 3*. Mainly due to the beds. Therefore I would not recommend to stay here, unless you like to sleep on concrete :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: BobRadu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of amenities and the service is excellent. When the reception desk found out that we would not be able to eat breakfast as our flight was too early, they prepared two lunch boxes for us to take in the morning. The room service is also very good. However, I will not stay at this hotel again as the beds were the most uncomfortable beds I have ever slept on. It felt like we were sleeping on the floor. I can't imagine that they don't get more complains about this seeing as they are a 4 or 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ali Baba and his Forty Thieves have nothing on this Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: sailboyDevon
Reviews.Content: This hotel which is I have to say convenient to the airport charges exorbitant amouts for everything from drinks to food and the service and attitude are very poor. The swimming pool charges 10 Lira for a mandatory swimming cap!!!!!!!!. Drinks in both the bar and the mini bar are incredibly expensive. My advice is stay somewhere else nif you can.

Reviews.Title: “Utilitarian and near the airport”
Reviews.Author: RLDublin
Reviews.Content: Reasonable if you can get a corporate rate, but a beer or a coffee costs a fortune for the location. Fine if you want to be right by the airport, but otherwise stay somewhere with a view!

Reviews.Title: “very average--not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: licksmith
Reviews.Content: we stayed two nights because of a conference next door-- room did look very nice-big bed nice mirrors- nice bathroom--nice touch screen control switches for aircom and lights -- nice tv set into the mirror design-quiet aircom--down side-- broken window catch highlighed by the sticker beside it that stated be careful if you had children to secure the window ?!?-- hadn't just happened judging by the tail tail marks around the window--poor choice of hollow pillows and what just isn't acceptable for any 5 star hotel anywhere is that the staff could be bothered to even clean the coffee cups or replemish the coffee sachets that were used-- i did see one member of room staff- he tried to enter the room without the courtesy of ringing our bell when we were both sitting undressed on the bed----breakfast could have been better if they didn't only have one slow member of staff to handle the egg station- i and other guests just gave up waiting and walked away--another negative i have never seen at any other 5 star hotel breakfast is a surcharge of 6 lire for a glass of fresh orange juice if you don't fancy the glow in the dark chemical alternative in the container-- on the good side a very nice coffee machine , fabulous bread, great chesses and good quality soups-intreging fresh honey- display--the whole set up is a shame because a lot of money most have been spent but the all th e paving to the rear are collapsing into monster pothao;es already and its the fine basic detail of room service that even 3 star options can get right- most times--close to the airport yes - next door the conference centre but that's it-- could try the hotel bar but at Â£14 for a pint of lager and a handful of complimentry nuts with a tax added to that on exit one pint was enough and the courtesy bus to town is at 3 hour interval's -- asking the hotel to lay on the hotel transport to the sophia airport--no trouble paying them 150 lire but all we got was ford connect size vehicle with a driver that tried to complete the whole journey at 140 kph in what was no more than a converted bread delivery van who flashed every vehicle in his path including us being only a few feet away from a motor bike's rear wheel whilst doing 152 kmh - we passed thro the toll both that luckely he didn't have to stop at doing 115 kmh i really never thought those vans could travel so fast--well our estimated transfer time to allow was up to 2 hrs for the journey and he did it in 40 minutes flat - thats the wow to sophia airport -- you may say but that not the hotels fault, i'm sorrry but we paid that 5star hotel 150 lire for their transporation--with a cange of management it really could be a nice set up because some features are nice but i suggest no this millenium

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own food!”
Reviews.Author: Fittraveller77
Reviews.Content: Having travelled throughout Turkey, I can say this is the worst food I have eaten and the restaurant service was poor. I know that you will think it was silly to try to stay and eat close to the airport but sometimes flight times dictate this. I chose a hotel which was rated 5 star but it was a mistake, my advice is to choose a lower priced family run hotel as they take pride in providing guests with a superior experience.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here ONLY if you need to do business near the convention center”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Lorenzo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one trump card on its hand: the extremely close location to the airport and to the business center next door. The World Trade Center is also only about 10 minutes walk away, as does the closest tram station. The hotel itself is just about average, as it is a business / transit hotel. The price premium for this however, is very large. I feel like a commodity staying here, they even seal the minibar section with a paper band stapled together, so they will know if you have opened it. I don't know why they do this thing. The staff is a little bit sparse and they process you like a procedure, not out of the way to be welcoming, just average. The breakfast buffet is also your standard hotel buffet, offering the usual fare with one exception: the very very nice and smooth tomato soup! As I wrote in the title, a very specific hotel for a very specific need, which it does well at a slightly higher price.

Reviews.Title: “A rip off but, OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: Quest I
Reviews.Content: The hotel is way overpriced. The only good thing about it is the hotel shuttle service. The bartender tried to charge me 20 dollars in Turkish money for a small glass of beer. Restaurant is OK but overpriced as well. Bottom line: only stay here if you want to be close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Transit Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IanX255060
Reviews.Content: For a traveller staying a single night in Istanbul between flights, the WOW hotel is ideal. Clean modern rooms, good free internet, free shuttle, excellent breakfast and friendly staff. (When a waiter saw how exhausted I was, he offered me a coffee on the house!) Food and drink are expensive but not outrageously so - you make up for it on the room rate compared to other similar airport hotels. Do not stay here if you want to see the sights of Istanbul - you can get to the centre easily enough but it is much more fun to stay in town..

Reviews.Title: “Umm. Only go there is you are on business or need access to aiport”
Reviews.Author: markgroberts
Reviews.Content: It's a convention hotel with close proximity to the airport. Everything is over priced. Service is average. Beds are uncomfortable. Great access to the Airport and metro into city (40 minutes with one change). Staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: vjhandley
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at end of March. The hotel has a good location to the airport. It is not too far from the city centre (30 mins on tram/train) etc. Good size rooms. Free internet but not wireless. Beds a bit hard and can hear the airport a bit. Drinks extremely expressive (Â£5 for a coke) but food prices not so bad buffer (Â£25 with a glass of wine). Can get a take away lunch bag if you are getting up early and missing breakfast. Staff were ok but we got a lot of promises to get back to us on things which never happened.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel room...wish was there longer”
Reviews.Author: icebaby0
Reviews.Content: Overall the room can be rated 4 to 5 stars (actual...i.e. 4/5 or 5/5). The room was spacious, clean (no sticky carpet), bathroom didn't have leaky bathtubs, etc. The breakfast was fantastic. However, they do not keep track who is going into for breakfast and who isn't....so I guess people can bring other guests in without a worry?

Reviews.Title: “3 Star hotel w/ 4 star and 5 star pricing”
Reviews.Author: Myine
Reviews.Content: I can honest say that the negatives about this hotel are so strong that I can find nothing positive to write about. To start it all off, they stood at the door and watched myself and my fiancee struggle with bringing the luggage inside the hotel. After finally making it to our room, we were there for about 15 minutes and my fiancee was about to prepare for a shower, and a staff member (man) made two quick knocks at the door then barged right in. Then claimed he was in the wrong room. So I guess they just give master keys (master card-key) to the staff to just go into any room they feel like and when they feel like it. I was quite angry at this person for doing that. A few seconds earlier and he would have walked in on my fianc'ee. A claimed-to-be, 4 star hotel and they haven't figured out how to put wireless internet in place yet. if you would like to use the internet in your room and if you do not bring your own cable, Guess what? They will sell one to you. Isn't that sweet of them? If you and your partner want to use the internet simultaneously, then one of you will have to go to the lobby where they degrade themselves even more to make their lobby look like a internet cafe. If you want to eat breakfast in your room, you can, at a very high price. Apparently the room breakfast is brought to you from Greece or Germany or Italy. I mean, at that price, there is no way that is came from downstairs. By the way, don't waste your time trying to get fresh air in the morning or at anytime of the day. if you are in your room, that is. The windows are locked shut not even a small opening for fresh air. I am just simply tired of writing I could go on for a few pages. But perhaps you will get the idea about our stay there and the WOW Hotel and convention center near the Ataturk Airport.. But I must say they did give it the correct name...WOW because I have to say WOW!!!! how did they get the audacity to call that place a 4 star Hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent if you know what you want”
Reviews.Author: bhaviksoni
Reviews.Content: I was visiting Istanbul for 2 days and one night for an exhibition. I needed a hotel close to the airport and exhibition hall. This hotel is 5 minutes by cab from the airport and 5 minutes walk from the exhibition hall. I needed a clean room with bathroom, decent breakfast, lots of TV channels, Free Internet and Easy transport to/from the city center. Because they were overbooked and gave me my room late, to compensate they upgraded me. The room was spacious, clean, nice bathroom with toiletries, LCD tv with decent channels, next to the metro station, free internet and the breakfast was decent but not great. Would I stay here on holiday? No really as I would like to stay in the city center. But if you are coming to Istanbul for an exhibition, I this this is the best option.

Reviews.Title: “its not really a WOW hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariop79
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel and its only suitable for someone who is going to fly from Istanbul Ataturk International airport,since its really close only 5 minutes by car or taxi. This hotel have two buildings,one is four star and the other is five star.but its really hard to tell the difference from outside. There is nothing surrounding the hotel property,if you look for something to eat you must go by taxi to the nearest shooping center Galleria which is 10 minutes away by taxi. In term of room size,this hotel is ok since its location so they can built a bigger room.

Reviews.Title: “Close to airport and city centre easy accessible”
Reviews.Author: Akulon
Reviews.Content: Stayed close to the airport because of early flights. The hotel has a shuttle bus every half an hour to the airport. The hotel is close to the light rail so that you can reach the city centre in half an hour for just a couple of Lira without the risk of trafic jam. The hotel is a typical business hotel. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The restaurant is nothing special. The staff is helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Forget about it !”
Reviews.Author: maperrin
Reviews.Content: NOT a five stars ! Looks very practical, close to airpt. However a real trap ! Reception wanted to charge First 3 times one night stay, as a guarantee ! Then they said that our credit card did not work, and asked for cash. As we refused, suddenly our card worked and we were compelled to sign a 350 Euros guarantee. When going to our room 2 employees went with us, one with luggage, the other trying to sell all type of "touristic" services, from taxi to tour, restaurants, etc..etc..Then both insisted for a tip !!!! When leaving troubles again, overcharging, pressures for tips, etc..etc..

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: pernicketytraveler
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here for our last night of a three week tour of Turkey. We chose this hotel due to its close proximity to the airport, as we flew in there from Izmir one day at 3pm and needed to fly out early the next morning again. Yes, it's very close so no wasted time in transit, but that is all. We had booked a room that was supposed to be a triple according to the web site, however, when we arrived we were told all rooms were standard with only a queen. This meant that a cot was brought in for our teenage daughter. I was not pleased as this was one of the reasons we had booked there. Our room was in the 4 star section and was ok, but basic, the bed was too hard. The carpets could be cleaner. We were not impressed with the service at the restaurant when we went to have a look and ask about dinner options. So we walked over the the 5 star side to check it out, and were greeted by very helpfull staff. We enjoyed the food and the service here was excellent. But be aware that this is an expensive place, which takes advandage of it's customers. When we went to the restaurant to buy bottled water for our room, I was shocked at the price of 5 lira for small and 9 lira for large. This is crazy in a place where bottled water is not an option. We did take the shuttle at 6:30am to the airport and that was good. We would not stay here again, there are other options in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Only good for the airport”
Reviews.Author: vicken11
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel as he was involved in a conference, which was being held in the attached conference centre. Its not somewhere we probably would have chosen otherwise as the location of the hotel is a long way outside of the centre and sights of Istanbul. The only time this hotel would be a good place to stay is if you have an overnight stay either going or leaving the airport, as this is a short distance away, albeit not in the flight path of the planes - so no noise from that. There is the netro system that has a stop about 50m from the hotel that would get you to the city centre, however we did not brave that and understood it would take 3 different trams to get us there. The hotel itself is ok, not the 5 star in brands itself to be though. The rooms are ok, fairly modern with nice firm beds and good air conditioning. Breaskfast is fine as well with a large selection of foods covering most cuisines. The food in the hotel is not too expensive, however the price of alcohol is astronomical - we're talking Â£6 for a small bottle of beer, and the water is Â£2 for a small bottle, which is particularly harsh considering its a hot country and the tap water is undrinkable. The minibar is even worse, with some spirts being around Â£10 for a small bottle - avoid!!! The hotel does run free shuttle services to the airport and city centre, although the one into town drops you at an area called Taksim Square, and to our minds there was nothing in this area. We ended up paying 40 lira each (Â£15) to go on a tour bus which eventually took us to the Sultanahmet area where the Blue Mosque, St Sophia and Bazaar are. There are also many restauarants and shops in this area, so definitely the place to be. We could have gone back to Taksim Square by tour bus to get the coach home, but we needed to leave before this, therfeore our options were either a very expensive taxi back to the hotel, or (as we did it), get on one of the airport shuttles for 10 lira and pay them a bit more to take us to our hotel. Though you may find that people do not know of the hotel. All in all, I think partly because of the location of this hotel and its remoteness, neither of us had the best of times in Istanbul and wouldn't come back. You would be much better to stay in a hotel in the centre of Istanbul than this one.

HotelInfo.Name: WOW Hotel & Convention Center
HotelInfo.Address: Istanbul Dunya Ticaret Merkezi, Istanbul 34110, Turkey
